img.alt: Block slides down one inclined plane, then rolls up the other

problem.p: Two prisms of equal masses \(m\) are placed on a horizontal surface. Each prism has a vertical height \(H\) and makes an angle \(\theta\) with the horizontal. A small block of mass \(m\) is held at rest at the top of one of the prisms. After the block is released, it slides down and then slides up the other prism. There is no friction between the prisms and the block and between the prisms and the horizontal surface. What maximum vertical height \(h\) will be reached by the block on the second prism?
